description.content: Recipient on Digital Disbursement can save their Payment Method(ACH, Debit, Prepaid, Paypal, Venmo, E check) which they can use to receive Payments later. DDP generates a unique token id for each Payment Method Vaulted.

variable.description: (Required) Unique id generated by DDP When Client creates a recipient proile. Merchant can also send unique merchant customer id which is used to create a recipient profile.

header.description: (Required) API key provided to the merchant associating the requests with the appropriate app in the Developer Portal.
(Required) Epoch timestamp in milliseconds in the request from a client system. Used for authorization header generation and time limit (5 minutes).
(Required) A client-generated ID for request tracking and signature creation, unique per request. This is also used for idempotency control. Recommended 128-bit UUID format.

item.name: This API is to create the New Money Network Card for Recipients on Disbursement portal.

request.name: This API is to create the New Money Network Card for Recipients on Disbursement portal.

description.content: This API is to create the New Money Network Card for Recipients on Disbursement portal.

variable.description: (Required) Unique Id associated with Recipient Profile while set up. The value can be MerchantCustomerId or RecipientId. Merchant provision through Apigee should always pass MerchantCustomerId.

header.description: (Required) An API key is a string value passed by a client app to the API proxies. The key uniquely identifies the client app.
(Required) Epoch timestamp in the request initiating system

(Required) Contains a unique ID generated by the client that can be used for enforcing idempotency on POST actions. POSTs are inherently non-idempotent and submitting the exact same request multiple times would create duplicate resources. Note:- Omitting this header increases the risk of duplicate transactions.
(Required) System generated unique session ID from Money Network platform.

(Required) Epoch timestamp in the request initiating system

(Required) Contains a unique ID generated by the client that can be used for enforcing idempotency on POST actions. (Required) System generated unique session ID from Money Network platform.

item.name: Retrieve vaulted payment method using vault id.

request.name: Retrieve vaulted payment method using vault id.

description.content: This API retrieve payment method for which vault id is provided in request url path.

variable.description: (Required) Unique id generated by DDP When Client creates a recipient proile. Merchant can also send unique merchant customer id which is used to create a recipient profile.

(Required) Unique DDP vault Id associated with funding Payment method information. Returned in response when payment method information is vaulted and can be retrieved using get accounts call after creation.
(Required) This is provided by merchant at the time of payment initialization. This must be associated with recipient.

header.description: (Required) API key provided to the merchant associating the requests with the appropriate app in the Developer Portal.
(Required) Epoch timestamp in milliseconds in the request from a client system. Used for authorization header generation and time limit (5 minutes).
(Required) A client-generated ID for request tracking and signature creation, unique per request. This is also used for idempotency control. Recommended 128-bit UUID format.
Token provided by hosted payment page public key/tokens API when PCI data is encrypted on hosted payment page. This is to identify public key associated with access token to decrypt the PCI data.

(Required) Unique DDP vault Id associated with funding Payment method information. Returned in response when payment method information is vaulted and can be retrieved using get accounts call after creation.
(Required) This is provided by merchant at the time of payment initialization. This must be associated with recipient.

header.description: (Required) API key provided to the merchant associating the requests with the appropriate app in the Developer Portal.
(Required) Epoch timestamp in milliseconds in the request from a client system. Used for authorization header generation and time limit (5 minutes).

(Required) Authorization header used to ensure the request has not been tampered with during transmission. Valid encryption; HMAC. For more information, refer to the supporting documentation on the Developer Portal. Format- `HMAC {hmacToken}`
(Required) A client-generated ID for request tracking and signature creation, unique per request. This is also used for idempotency control. Recommended 128-bit UUID format.
Token provided by hosted payment page public key/tokens API when PCI data is encrypted on hosted payment page. This is to identify public key associated with access token to decrypt the PCI data.
(Required) used to indicate the media type of the resource.

description.content: This API updates the vaulted Debit card, update default payment method, Activate or Deactivate vaulted account.
